items.definition_en: disposed to warfare or hard-line policies

items.definition_en: affirm once again

items.definition_en: a legislator who gives long speeches in an effort to delay or obstruct legislation that he (or she) opposes
items.context_sentence: 5. South Korea's National Assembly today passed a revised Criminal Act bill, creating the crime of "legal distortion," after a ruling party-led motion brought an end to an opposition filibuster and the bill cleared the chamber in a vote.

The amendment, one of the Democratic Party’s three flagship judicial reform measures, limits its application to criminal cases and clarifies its provisions amid earlier concerns over constitutionality.

items.definition_en: A worthless person; a hooligan or lout.

items.definition_en: a maker of laws; someone who gives a code of laws
